question: 微か
sourceMnemonic: The kanji is <kanji>delicate</kanji>, and the vocab has this meaning too. It's that kind of "subtle" delicate, not so much that something will break (like it is with the kanji). Something that is a bit <vocabulary>faint</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>indistinct</vocabulary> is going to be delicate in this sense, perhaps, too.
sourceReadingMnemonic: If you're going to <reading>cuss</reading> (<ja>かす</ja>) up a storm, that's not really being <vocabulary>delicate</vocabulary>.
